Demo: PIR Motion Sensor

The PIR Motion Sensor, or Passive Infrared Sensor, is a sensor that takes a snapshot of the room and sets the 'alarm' pin to 'LOW' if it detects changes in heat. Since this sensor is an open collector, it needs a pull-up resistor on the alarm pin, which allows multiple motion sensors to be connected on a single input pin.

Example 

var b = require('bonescript');
b.pinMode('P8_19', b.INPUT);
setInterval(checkPIR, 2000); // Checks the Sensor Every 2 Seconds

function checkPIR(){
b.digitalRead('P8_19', printStatus);
}

function printStatus(x) {
    if(x.value === 0){
    console.log("Motion Detected");
    }
    else{
    console.log("No Motion Dected");
    }
}




Build and execute instructions

  • Connect the "GND" pin from the sensor to P9.1 of the BeagleBoard.
  • Connect the "+5" pin from the sensor to P9.3 of the BeagleBoard.
  • Connect the AN pin from the sensor to P9.40 of the BeagleBoard.
  • Click "Run" on the code and it will output the distance, in inches that your sensor is detecting every 5 seconds.
  • Move the sensor closer to or away from an object to see the change in distance.
